item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Samuel Lover
item.description: "Circumstances are the rulers of the weak; they are but the instruments of the wise." -- Samuel Lover

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by William Shakespeare
Cláudia add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness." -- André Breton

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "To err is human, to forgive, divine." -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Federico García Lorca
item.description: "To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves." -- Federico García Lorca

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Gary Paulsen
item.description: "If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books. The book needs you." -- Gary Paulsen

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Anderson Cooper
item.description: "The farther you go...the harder it is to return. The world has many edges and it's easy to fall off." -- Anderson Cooper

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Michael Palin
item.description: "You can't get a suit of armour and a rubber chicken just like that. You have to plan ahead." -- Michael Palin

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "If I'm sincere today, what does it matter if I regret it tomorrow?" -- José Saramago

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by Rob Reiner
item.description: "Everybody talks about wanting to change things and help and fix, but ultimately all you can do is fix yourself. And that's a lot. Because if you can fix yourself, it has a ripple effect." -- Rob Reiner

item.title: Cláudia add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be." -- John Cheever
